content.rendered:
Welcome to our website. This website uses cookies, which are small text files containing information that are stored on your device (e.g. your computer, mobile phone or tablet) when you visit a website. Cookies can enable the website to store certain information so that you do not have to re-enter it when you return to the website or when you move from one part of the website to another.

This cookie policy explains how and when we, Mannheimer Swartling Advokatbyrå AB, reg. no. 556399-4499 (“Mannheimer Swartling” or “we”), with address Norrlandsgatan 21, 111 87 Stockholm, use cookies on www.mannheimerswartling.se (the “Website”).

You can read more about cookies at https://allaboutcookies.org/.

Cookies on the Website

We only use cookies that are necessary for the Website to function properly, for example, to enable you to use the Website’s features. We do not use advertising cookies, but some services that are provided by third parties. Services and features that you have specifically requested, such as submitting forms, applications or registering for our events, cannot be provided without these cookies, so these cookies are always active on the website. A small number of additional functional cookies, i.e. cookies that are only used to provide or improve a function, require your consent.

The tables below list the cookies used on the Website.

First-party cookies

The Website needs certain cookies to function. The following cookies are managed directly by us and enable the Website’s features for language and consent settings. These cookies are always active and cannot be opted out of.

Cookie Purpose Stored information Storage period Sharing
pll_language For some features to work properly, this cookie needs to be available. The language code from the page last visited by the user on the Website. 1 year No
cookies_and_content_security_policy  Indication by the user that he/she is aware of the use of cookiess. If the user clicked OK 3 months No

 

Cookies provided by a service provider (so-called third-party cookies)

Lime

On the Website we use Lime Forms as a tool for our digital forms to subscribe to our newsletter or alumni network. When you use these forms, limited cookies are enabled. These cookies are only used to enable you to use the function or service you have specifically requested. These cookies are always active and cannot be opted out of.

Cookie Purpose Stored information Storage period Sharing
simpliform_session Generated by Lime Forms, used to identify the session. Token 8 hours No
XSRF-TOKEN Generated by Lime Forms, essential for safety and stability. Token 8 hours No

 

Onecruiter

Cookie Purpose Stored information Storage period Sharing
language Remember selected language. Language code. Session Yes
open_application Remember the choices you made on the application form. Location ID, job category ID and role ID. No time limit No
visitor Collects statistics on the number of unique visitors without collecting personal information or tracking user behavior. Unique ID (UUID). No time limit. No

 

Our recruitment system also uses other functional cookies. These cookies are only activated with your consent and are used to collect statistics that help us evaluate the performance of our advertising channels. This helps us to improve your experience and make it easier for you to find relevant jobs.

Cookie Purpose Stored information Storage period Sharing
global_ref Identify which page the user visited before coming to the recruitment page. Browser reference. 7 days No
position_ref Identify which page the user visited before coming to the recruitment page. Browser reference. 7 days No

Processing of personal data

For essential cookies, which are only enabled for the services you have requested on the Website, your personal data will be processed on the basis of our legitimate interest in providing a functional and secure Website.

When you access the Website, you will be asked to consent to the use of non-essential cookies. By giving your consent, you allow us to place cookies and process relating personal data. You are not required to consent to the use of these cookies in order to access the Website. However, some services and features require the use of cookies and may be limited or unavailable without your consent.

You may withdraw your consent to cookies and analytics at any time by clicking here or by contacting us at dataprotection@msa.se.

If you wish to delete cookies previously stored on your computer, instructions can be found on all browser support pages.

For more information about how we process your personal data and how you can exercise your rights, please see our Privacy Notice.

Changes to this Cookie Policy

If you have any questions about how we process personal data or use cookies, please contact us at dataprotection@msa.se.

We reserve the right to make changes to this Cookie Policy at any time, to the extent necessary to correct errors or to comply with new legal and technical requirements. Any changes to this Cookie Policy will be posted on the Website.

Last updated 25 November 2024.
